creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund and the Driscoll Art Accessions Endowment Fund
inscription: Verso, inscribed in black ink: Königs See
markings: Verso, LR, printed label: 399; UL: handwritten label: 20; at center: typed German label [affixed after 1957] with tombstone, provenance, exhibition history, and bibliography.
provenance:
[Friedrich Jakob Gsell (1812-1871), Vienna (after 1841–d. 1871; his estate sale, through Georg Plach at Künstlerhaus, Vienna, March 14, 1872, no. 399, as “Hallstädter See gegen Obertraun” [Lake Hallstatt towards Obertraun], to Ritter von Scanavi]; Johann Nikolaus Ritter von Scanavi (1820-1889), Vienna. Max Ritter von Gutmann (1857–1930), Vienna (by 1908–d. 1930); by descent to his daughter-in-law, Rosa von Gutmann [1] (until the late 1980s; sold to Galerie Sanct Lucas); [Galerie Sanct Lucas, Vienna, from the 1980s]. [Alexander Ridigier, Munich and London, 2024]

[1] Rosa von Gutmann, née Selhofer (1912-2003) was married to Wolfgang Ritter von Gutmann (1906-1964), the son of Max Ritter von Gutmann and Emilie von Gutmann
signed: Signed, lower left, in brown paint: Waldmüller / 1840
title: Mountains over Lake Hallstatt
